shortcontents.shortcontent: I) Dǝrsanat, Homiliary (fols. 3r-118ra) I-1) Homily by Jacob of Serug on the Annunciation and on the Virgin Mary and Elizabeth (fols. 3r-4rb) (cp. Orient. 774, no. 1) I-2) Homily by Jacob (of Serug) on the visit of Mary to Elizabeth (fols. 4va-6rb) (cp. Orient. 774, no. 2) I-3) Homily by Jacob (of Serug) on the vision of Joseph (fol. 6ra-8ra)(cp. Orient. 774, no. 3) I-4) Homily by John Chrysostom on the Nativity of Jesus (fols. 8ra-11rb) (cp. Orient. 774, no. 4) I-5) Homily by Theophilus of Constantinople on St. Stephen the Protomartyr (fols. 11r-14vb)(cp. Orient. 774, no. 5) I-6) Homily by John Chrysostom on the Baptism of Our Lord (i) (fols. 15ra-17ra) (cp. Orient. 774, no. 6) I-7) Homily by John Chrysostom on the wedding of Cana (fols. 17r-20rb)(cp. Orient. 774, no. 8) I-8) Homily by John Chrysostom on the Baptism of Our Lord (ii) (fols. 20rb-22vb) (cp. Orient. 774, no. 7) I-9) Homily by John Chrysostom on the sinful woman who anointed the feet of Our Lord with ointment (fols. 22vb-30vb) (cp. Orient. 774, no. 9) I-10) Homily by Jacob of Serug on Simeon the priest who received Jesus in the temple (fols. 31ra-34vb) (cp. Orient. 774, no. 10) I-11) Homily by Ephrem on fasting, repentance and prayer (fols. 34vb-36vb) I-12) Homily by anonymous author (“one of the holy fathers”) on the man who was born blind (fols. 36vb-37vb), incomplete I-13) Homily by Anastasius of Däbrä Sina on the burial of Our Lord (fols. 38ra-rb), incomplete, acephalous (cp. MY-002, fol. 64vb l.7 from below). I-14) Homily by John Chrysostom on Easter Sunday (fols. 38rb-40rb) I-15) Homily by John Theologus on Easter Sunday (fols. 40va-45rb) (cp. Orient. 774, no. 22; MY-002, fols. 73va-81vb) I-16) Homily by Jacob of Serug on the Apostle Thomas (fols. 45va-48vb) I-17) Homily by John Chrysostom on Lazarus (fols. 49rb-50vb) I-18) Homily by John Chrysostom on the Samaritan woman (fols. 50vb-53vb) I-19) Homily by Ephrem on Satan and death (fols. 54ra-57vb) (cp. Orient. 774, no. 16) I-21) Homily by Jacob of Serug on the angel and the thief (fols. 60rb-66vb) (incomplete?) I-22) Homily by Anǝsṭasyos of Däbrä Sina on the burial of Our Lord (fols. 66ra-74rb) (cp. Orient. 774, no. 19) I-23) Homily by John Chrysostom on Passion of Our Lord (fols. 74rb-78vb) I-24) Homily by Ephrem on Palm Sunday (i) (fols. 78vb-81rb) I-25) Homily by Ephrem on Palm Sunday (ii) (fols. 81rb-86rb) I-26) Homily by John Chrysostom on Palm Sunday (fol. 86rb-89rb) I-27) Homily by John Chrysostom on the Pharisee and the publican (fols. 90r-92vb) I-28) Homily by the Orthodox on the holy spiritual Easter (fols. 92vb-94vb) I-29) Homily by John Chrysostom on the Apostle Thomas (fols. 95rb-97va) I-30) Homily by John Chrysostom on repentance (fols. 97va-102vb) (cp. Orient 774, no. 29; MY-002, 138ra-143rb) I-31) The Story of John of Rome who acquired the “Golden Gospel” (fols. 103ra-106ra) (cp. Orient. 774, no. 30) I-32) Homily by John Chrysostom on the Ten Virgins (fols. 106ra-110ra) (cp. Orient. 774, no. 31) I-33) Homily by Anǝsṭasyos of Däbrä Sina on the Transfiguration (fols. 110ra-115va) (cp. Orient. 774, no. 32) I-34) Homily by Jacob of Serug on the words of the angel to Zacharias (fols. 115v-118ra)

copyists.copyist: The scribe has mentioned his own name, Habtä ʾIyäsus, in a subscription (exhortation, fol. 118ra).

txstates.txstate: The leather overback is slightly damaged at the head and tail. Some fols. may be missing. Some quires may be missplaced. The biggest part of fol. 118 is cut off.

bindings.binding: Two wooden boards covered with reddish brown tooled leather (quarter cover). Two pairs of sewing stations.

inks.ink: Black; red (reddish brown in fols. 15r, 38r, 40v, 45v, 90r and elsewhere)

squires.squire: A(2: s.l.: 1, stub after 1; 2, stub before stub of 1/fols. 1r-2v) – I(8/fols. 3r-10v) – II(2/fols. 11r-14v) – III(8/fols. 15r-22v) – IV(7; s.l.: 2, stub after 6/fols. 23r-30v) – V(7; s.l.: 1, no stub/fols. 31r-37v) – VI(8/fols. 38r-45v) – VII(8/fols. 46r-53v) – VIII(8/fols. 54r-61v) – IX(8/fols. 62r-69v) – X(8/fols. 70r-77v) – XI(6/fols. 78r-83v) – XII(6; s.l.: 3, stub after 2; 5, stub after 1/fols. 84r-89v) – XIII(8/fols. 90r-98v) – XIV(5; s.l.: 3, stub after 1/fols. 99r-102v) – XV(8; s.l.: 3, stub after 6; 5, stub after 3/fols. 103r-110v) – XVI(8/fols. 111r-118v) – B(1/fol. 119).

taunit.rl-info: Pricking and ruling are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are mostly visible. Ruling pricks are mostly visible. The upper line is written above the ruling (above the ruling in fol. 103 and elsewhere). The bottom line is written above the ruling. The scribe did not use the upper two lines on fol. 2r. The bottom ruled line is not used on fols. 49v-50v.

pchangeofhands.pchangeofhand: - ጠ (1st order) and ጣ (4th order) can hardly be distinguished (e.g., fol. 37ra).

otherdetails.otherdetail: Subscriptions on fol. 14vb, 30vb, 118rb. Rubrication appears to have been completed by two hands; one is the main hand, the second is distinct from it, using a different tone of red (reddish brown) on fols. 15r, 38r, 40v, 45v, 90r and elsewhere).

extras.extra: - Cues for the rubricator: names of the feasts or occasions for reading written in small script (in more than one hand), in the upper margins of some fols. (sometimes cut): fols. 16r, 17r, 31r (partly trimmed), 67ra (upper margin), 74r (with no rubricated note), 92v (partly trimmed), 95r. - The scribe used compressed script on fols. 53v, 69v and elsewhere. - Erasure: fol. 52ra - Words and passages written over erasures: fols. 61ra, 62rb, 79rb, 86rb. - A few words effaced: fols. 70vb-71rb

txfindingaids.txfindingaid: - Thread inserted in the upper corner of some fols. for navigating in the text: fols. 74, 92v - Readings are indicated by the names of the feasts written in the upper margin: በብርሃናት፡ fol. 4v በኖላዊ፡ fol. 6r በጌና፡ ምንባብ፡ fol. 8r በዕለተ፡ እስጢፋኖስ፡ fol. 11r በጥምቀት፡ ምንባበ፡ fol. 15r በቃና፡ ምንባበ፡ fol. 17r በሣልሳይ፡ ጥምቀት፡ fol. 20r ኣመ፮፡ ለየካቲተ፡ fol. 23v በስምዖን፡ ፰፡ ለየካቲተ፡ fol. 31r በድራረ ጾም፡ fol. 34v በሣልስ ሰንበተ ጾም፡ fol. 36v በዕለተ በዓለ ፋሲካ፡ fols. 38r በሰኑየ ፋሲካ፡ fol. 40va በሰሉሳ ፋሲካ፡ fol. 45va በረቡዓ ፋሲካ፡ fol. 49ra በኃሙሰ ፋሲካ፡ fol. 50vb በዐርብ፡ በ፫፡ ሰዐት፡ fol. 54r በዐርብ፡ በ፮፡ ሰዐት፡ fol. 58r በዐርብ፡ በ፱፡ ሰዐት፡ fol. 60r በዐርብ፡ ሶበ፡ የዐርብ፡ ፀሐይ፡ fol. 67r ንቅዎተ፡ ዶርሆ፡ fol. 74 (in a different, more recent hand) በዐርበ ሆሳዕና፡ ምንባብ፡ fol. 78v በቀዳሚት፡ ሰንበት፡ ሆሳዕና፡ fol. 81r በ <...> ሰንበተ፡ ሆሳዕና፡ fol. 86r በሰዱስ፡ ፋሲካ፡ fol. 90 r ለሰቡዓ፡ ፋሲካ፡ fol. 92v በሰሙነ፡ ፋሲካ፡ fol. 95r <…>: fol. 97v ዮሐንስ፡ ወንጌሉዘወርቅ፡ fol. 103r ዘዘካርያስ፡ fol. 115v

drawing.details: The image was drawn probably in the post-16th cent. period. A recent inscription by pen is inserted into the drawing.
